    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageStegIOAndroid

        public ImageStegIOAndroid(byte[] image,
                          boolean useTransparent)

        Creates an object that exists to handle reading and writing of Bitmaps to and from byte arrays as well as choosing the appropriate encoders (and their overlays) for the given image. It holds on to the image during its en- or decoding.

        The image will only be processed if the methods getFormat() or getEncoder() are called.

        Parameters:
        image - the image to handle In- and Output of
        useTransparent - ignored (always false) due to more frequent Bitmap inaccuracies whenever transparent pixels are involved

    • Method Detail

      • getImageAsByteArray

        public byte[] getImageAsByteArray()
                           throws ImageWritingException

        Returns the image in its current state (Output-Image) as a byte Array.

        If the image was not yet processed, return == input

        Specified by:
        getImageAsByteArray in interface ImageStegIO
        Returns:
        the image in its current state as a byte array
        Throws:
        ImageWritingException - if the image was not written to a byte array for unknown reasons

      • getFormat

        public java.lang.String getFormat()
                           throws NoImageException,
                                  UnsupportedImageTypeException

        Returns the images format.

        Processes the image if necessary.

        Specified by:
        getFormat in interface ImageStegIO
        Returns:
        the images format (png, bmp, ...) as a String
        Throws:
        UnsupportedImageTypeException - if the image type read from input is not supported
        NoImageException - if no image could be read from input

      • getEncoder

        public BitmapEncoder getEncoder(long seed)
                         throws UnsupportedImageTypeException,
                                NoImageException

        Determines and returns the suitable encoder (and overlay) for the image according to its type.

        In the current state, this will always be the PixelBit encoder with an overlay that only uses pixels with an alpha value of 255.

        Processes the image if it was not processed already.

        Specified by:
        getEncoder in interface ImageStegIO
        Parameters:
        seed - to hand to the overlay
        Returns:
        BuffImgEncoder with set PixelCoordinateOverlay, chosen accordingly to the images type
        Throws:
        UnsupportedImageTypeException - if the images type is not supported by any known encoder / overlay
        NoImageException - if no image could be read from input

      • getOverlay

        protected PixelCoordinateOverlay getOverlay(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                            long seed)
                                     throws UnsupportedImageTypeException
        Returns an overlay according to global variable useTransparent.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - Bitmap to hand to overlay
        seed - Seed to hand to overlay
        Returns:
        ShuffleOverlay or NoTransparencyShuffleOverlay
        Throws:
        UnsupportedImageTypeException - if the image type is not supported by the overlay
